_description: Configure performance and rendering parameters for the swiip_pubdev_timeline widget. Copy this file to 'timeline_config.json' in your package root and customize as needed.

_dayWidth_info.description: Width of each day column in pixels
_dayWidth_info.performance_impact: Larger values = more detail and easier to read, but higher memory usage and more rendering work. Smaller values = more days visible at once but harder to read.
_dayWidth_info.recommendation: Use 70.0 for small datasets, 65.0 for medium (default), 50.0 for large

_dayMargin_info.description: Horizontal spacing between day columns in pixels
_dayMargin_info.performance_impact: Minimal impact on performance. Affects visual density and readability.
_dayMargin_info.recommendation: Use 5.0 for most cases, reduce to 3.0-4.0 for large datasets to fit more days

_bufferDays_info.description: Number of days to render outside the visible viewport on each side
_bufferDays_info.performance_impact: CRITICAL: Higher values = smoother scrolling but significantly higher memory usage. Each buffer day renders all rows for that day.
_bufferDays_info.recommendation: Use 5 for small datasets, 8 for medium (default), 10 for large. Values > 12 may cause memory issues on low-end devices.
_bufferDays_info.warning: ⚠️ Values greater than 12 can cause significant memory usage, especially with many rows. Monitor memory usage if increasing this value.

_animationDurationMs_info.description: Duration of scroll animations in milliseconds
_animationDurationMs_info.performance_impact: Longer animations feel smoother but take more time. Shorter animations are snappier but may feel abrupt.
_animationDurationMs_info.recommendation: Use 200ms for small datasets, 220ms for medium, 250ms for large
_animationDurationMs_info.note: This affects programmatic scrolling and auto-scroll behaviors

_rowHeight_info.description: Height of each stage row in pixels
_rowHeight_info.performance_impact: Larger values = easier to read and interact with, but fewer rows visible at once. Affects total timeline height.
_rowHeight_info.recommendation: Use 35.0 for better touch targets, 30.0 for standard, 25.0 to fit more rows

_rowMargin_info.description: Vertical spacing between stage rows in pixels
_rowMargin_info.performance_impact: Minimal impact. Affects visual density and separation between rows.
_rowMargin_info.recommendation: Use 3.0 for most cases, reduce to 2.0 for compact layouts

_datesHeight_info.description: Height of the date header row in pixels
_datesHeight_info.performance_impact: Minimal impact. Affects how much space the date indicators take.
_datesHeight_info.recommendation: Use 65.0 for standard layouts, adjust based on your date formatting needs

_timelineHeight_info.description: Total height of the timeline widget in pixels
_timelineHeight_info.performance_impact: Larger values = more rows visible at once but more rendering work. Smaller values = less rendering but more scrolling needed.
_timelineHeight_info.recommendation: Adjust based on your layout needs. Consider rowHeight * expected_visible_rows + datesHeight

_usage_notes.1: Copy this file to 'timeline_config.json' in your package root directory
_usage_notes.2: Remove all lines starting with '_' (these are comments and will be ignored by the parser)
_usage_notes.3: Modify only the values you want to customize
_usage_notes.4: If a parameter is invalid or missing, the default value will be used automatically
_usage_notes.5: Check the console for validation warnings if your configuration isn't working as expected

_recommended_configurations.description: Recommended parameter values for different dataset sizes

small_datasets.description: For < 100 days - Better visuals, smoother animations

large_datasets.description: For > 500 days - Prioritizes smoothness and performance

_troubleshooting.configuration_not_loading: Ensure the file is named 'timeline_config.json' and is in the package root directory
_troubleshooting.values_not_applied: Check console for validation errors. Invalid values are replaced with defaults.
_troubleshooting.performance_issues: Try using a preset for your dataset size, or reduce bufferDays
